dt: {bc}a public officer who attests or certifies writings (such as a deed) to make them authentic and takes affidavits, depositions, and protests of negotiable paper

et: Middle English {it}notary{/it} clerk, notary public, from Latin {it}notarius{/it} clerk, secretary, from {it}notarius{/it} of shorthand, from {it}nota{/it} note, shorthand character
shortdef: a public officer who attests or certifies writings (such as a deed) to make them authentic and takes affidavits, depositions, and protests of negotiable paper —called also notary
